summary: Medical platform with role-based access: Admin (code 1107) can view all doctor profiles, case records across departments, and dashboards (read-only). Doctors (code 2011) self-register, select from a fixed list of medical departments, and access cases related to their department. Customer support floating icon links to satyamjha2553@gmail.com.
architectural_notes: Role-based access: Admin (code 1107) is view-only; Doctor (code 2011) self-registers and gets department-scoped case access
Admin cannot assign doctors; doctors register themselves using the code
Departments are a fixed predefined list — doctors cannot create custom department names

existing_features.title: Update the DoctorPortal registration form to include a security code input field (code `2011`) and a department dropdown with the following fixed list: Cardiology, Neurology, Orthopedics, Pediatrics, Dermatology, Radiology, Oncology, Psychiatry, Gastroenterology, Urology, ENT, Ophthalmology, Gynecology, General Surgery, Emergency Medicine. The doctor can only register if the correct code is entered. After successful registration, the doctor sees only cases related to their department.

Update the AdminPortal to use passcode `1107` for authentication. After login, the admin dashboard must display: all registered doctor profiles (name, department, availability status) and all emergency cases across all departments — both in read-only mode with no edit or delete controls visible to admin.

Implement the SupportButton component as a floating circle button fixed to the bottom-right corner of every page. Clicking it opens the user's default email client addressed to `satyamjha2553@gmail.com`. The button should display a customer support icon (e.g., a headset or chat bubble) and have a tooltip or aria-label of 'Customer Support'.

new_feature_requests.summary: Admin role with code 1107 — view-only access to all doctor profiles, case records across departments, and dashboards
Doctor self-registration with code 2011 — selects from fixed list of medical departments, accesses cases related to their department

Fixed list of standard medical departments for doctor registration (Cardiology, Neurology, Orthopedics, Pediatrics, Dermatology, Radiology, Oncology, Psychiatry, Gastroenterology, Urology, ENT, Ophthalmology, Gynecology, General Surgery, Emergency Medicine)
Floating customer support circle icon on bottom-right linking to satyamjha2553@gmail.com

Update the backend to store a `registrationCode` field on doctor profiles. When a doctor registers, they must provide the code `2011` — if the code does not match, reject the registration with an error message. Store the doctor's selected department from the fixed list.

Update the backend admin authentication to use the hardcoded passcode `1107`. The admin role must have read-only access to all doctor profiles and all emergency cases across all departments. No admin create/edit/delete operations on doctors or cases.
